definition: Lien Chan (1936-), Taiwanese politician, former vice-president and chairman of Guomintang
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
fighting and winning a series of battles (idiom); ever victorious

sentences.english: The gunshot wound to Lien Chan's son's right temple is not believed to be life-threatening, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 報道說，連戰兒子右太陽穴的槍傷並不威脅生命。

sentences.english: Mr Lien wants to challenge the results.
sentences.chinese: 連戰希望推翻選舉結果。

sentences.english: Mr Lien and Mr Soong asked for a meeting with Mr Chen, but have been turned down.
sentences.chinese: 連戰和宋楚瑜要求和陳水扁見面，但被拒。

sentences.english: Pistons Lianjie Lien Chan, have three double-digit win.
sentences.chinese: 活塞連戰連捷，三場都勝出兩位數。

definition: Frank Chang-ting Hsieh (1946-), Taiwanese DPP politician, mayor of Kaohsiung 1998-2005
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
to conspire/to plot (a rebellion, crime etc)/to machinate/to spur on/to urge action
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
to fight with all one's might
